event.title: May 31, 1522, the first of the Spanish, under the leadership of Captain Pedro de Alvarado, disembarked

data.event: On May 31, 1522, the first of the Spanish, under the leadership of Captain Pedro de Alvarado, disembarked on the Isla Meanguera, located in the Gulf of Fonseca (Embajada).
In June 1524 Captain Alvarado began a war of conquest against the indigenous people of Cuzcatlán (land of precious things).

event.title: 17 days of bloody battles many people died

data.event: After 17 days of bloody battles many people died but the Spanish were not defeated, so they continued their conquest (Embajada).
During the following centuries the Spanish maintained their control, with European families controlling the land and the native and African slaves (Lonely Planet).

event.title: the end of 1810 the Priest José Matías Delgado, with the support of many people, began

data.event: Towards the end of 1810 the Priest José Matías Delgado, with the support of many people, began a rebellion (Embajada).

event.title: years of struggle, the Central American Independence Act was signed

data.event: After years of struggle, the Central American Independence Act was signed in Guatemala, on September 15, 1821 (Embajada).
